Detailed report: https://oss-fuzz.com/testcase?key=5631634545573888

Project: net-snmp
Fuzzer: afl_net-snmp_agentx_parse_fuzzer
Fuzz target binary: agentx_parse_fuzzer
Job Type: afl_asan_net-snmp
Platform Id: linux

Crash Type: Heap-buffer-overflow READ {*}
Crash Address: 0x61500000369a
Crash State:
  agentx_parse_string
  agentx_parse
  agentx_parse_fuzzer.c
  
Sanitizer: address (ASAN)

Recommended Security Severity: Medium

Regressed: https://oss-fuzz.com/revisions?job=afl_asan_net-snmp&range=201904270141:201904280141

Reproducer Testcase: https://oss-fuzz.com/download?testcase_id=5631634545573888

Issue filed automatically.

See https://github.com/google/oss-fuzz/blob/master/docs/reproducing.md for instructions to reproduce this bug locally.

This bug is subject to a 90 day disclosure deadline. If 90 days elapse
without an upstream patch, then the bug report will automatically
become visible to the public.

When you fix this bug, please
  * mention the fix revision(s).
  * state whether the bug was a short-lived regression or an old bug in any stable releases.
  * add any other useful information.
This information can help downstream consumers.

If you need to contact the OSS-Fuzz team with a question, concern, or any other feedback, please file an issue at https://github.com/google/oss-fuzz/issues.
Fixed by commit 7de049193ab7 ("AgentX: Avoid reading uninitialized data"). That commit fixes a bug that was introduced recently by commit 46a42549dbae ("AgentX: Reduce stack usage").

ClusterFuzz has detected this issue as fixed in range 201904280141:201904290141.
